intro: Dipcadi bussei, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a bulbous perennial plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces white or pale pink flowers with a pleasant fragrance, which attract pollinators such as bees and moths. Its leaves are grass-like, typically emerging from a basal rosette of fleshy, underground bulbs. Dipcadi bussei is well adapted to arid environments and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
